law.catch_line: Powers and duties of Environmental Board.
law.text:
The Environmental Board shall have the following powers and duties:
The board shall authorize and administer all expenditures from the environmental trust fund.
The board may conduct and fund environmental research, research and development projects, and environmental education programs that assist in implementing the policies and purposes of this chapter.
The board may contract with any state agency, federal agency, local government, university, nonprofit organization or private person to further the purposes of KRS 224.1-200 to 224.1-220.
The board may award grants to further the purposes of KRS 224.1-200 to 224.1-220.
The board may solicit, receive and consider proposals from any state agency, federal agency, local government, university, nonprofit organization or private person which further the purposes of KRS 224.1-200 to 224.1-220.
The board may solicit and accept money by grant, gift, donation, bequest or other conveyance to be credited to the environmental trust fund.
law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 129, sec. 4, effective July 13, 1990.
